title: How to play any game on a low-end PC - Quora

response.answer_text: There are several ways to play a game in your low end PC… First you'll need to download and install the game. Remember that some game came with game client. Some game also came in CD form. Buy the CD, put it inside your cd tray and usually it will ask you to autorun the cd. Usually you can just run to install it. And then launch the game. There are several ways to launch: By double clicking the game iconBy typing the game executable in shellBy browsing and locating the game executable in the run dialog or file explorer window.After the game start, click new game, start campaign or anything similar. Now you have a game started, usually you'll be guided by quick tutorial on how to play the game. Just follow it and you'll mostly fine. As an additional tips, for most game button W A S D on your keyboard usually means Forward, Left, Backward, Right respectively. Your mouse movement will change your field of view just like tilting your head. Button F will open function or interaction window, your mouse left click will means fire your weapon and escape means opening a main menu usually unrelated to gameplay but to your progress. Have fun!

TL,DR: play emulation, GBA, PSP, PS one. Great game, low end PC. I used to have a very low-end PC, the one play GTA Vice City at 30fps, so I guess I could share my experience. Don't be greedyThose AAA is overreaching so no use want to play it, you have to tune your expection a bit lower. Be tolerance to old gameOld game looks bad, play a bit less interesting but still, could be a great game if you learn how to enjoy it; and some could even have a great story, a nice gameplay, and suit your taste maybe. Sum upI suggest you try GBA, PS one, PSP game. Graphic is no where amazing, but amazing nonetheless.
